張.definition: to open up; to spread; sheet of paper; classifier for flat objects, sheet; classifier for votes

張三.definition: Zhang San, name for an unspecified person, first of a series of three: 張三|张三[Zhang1 San1], 李四[Li3 Si4], 王五[Wang2 Wu3] Tom, Dick and Harry; (dialect) wolf

張三李四.definition: lit. Zhang Three and Li Four (idiom); (fig.) any Tom, Dick or Harry

張三，李四，王五，趙六.pinyin: zhāng sān ， lǐ sì ， wáng wǔ ， zhào liù
張三，李四，王五，趙六.definition: (four proverbial names) Tom, Dick and Harry

張之洞.definition: Zhang Zhidong (1837-1909), prominent politician in late Qing

張伯倫.definition: Chamberlain (name); Wilt Chamberlain (1936-1999), US basketball player

張僧繇.definition: Zhang Sengyou (active c. 490-540), one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家

張儀.definition: Zhang Yi (-309 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)

張冠李戴.definition: lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head; to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom); to confuse one thing with another

張勳.definition: Zhang Xun (1854-1923), Qing loyalist general who attempted to restore the abdicated emperor Puyi 溥儀|溥仪[Pu3 yi2] to the throne in the Manchu Restoration of 1917 張勳復辟|张勋复辟[Zhang1 Xun1 Fu4 bi4]

張勳復辟.definition: Manchu Restoration of 1917, an attempt by general 張勳|张勋[Zhang1 Xun1] to reinstate the monarchy in China by restoring the abdicated emperor Puyi 溥儀|溥仪[Pu3 yi2] to the throne

張北.definition: Zhangbei county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei

張北縣.definition: Zhangbei county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei

張口.definition: to open one's mouth (to eat, speak etc); to gape; to start talking (esp. to make a request)

張口結舌.definition: agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words; gaping and speechless

張嘴.definition: to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request); to gape

張國榮.definition: Leslie Cheung (1956-2003), Hong Kong singer and actor

張國燾.definition: Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938

張大千.definition: Chang Dai-chien or Zhang Daqian (1899-1983), one of the greatest Chinese artists of the 20th century

張天翼.definition: Zhang Tianyi (1906-1985), children's writer, author of prize-winning fairy tale Secret of the Magic Gourd 寶葫蘆的秘密|宝葫芦的秘密[Bao3 hu2 lu5 de5 Mi4 mi4]

張太雷.definition: Zhang Tailei (1898-1927), founding member of Chinese communist party

張學友.definition: Jacky Cheung or Hok Yau Jacky (1961-), Cantopop and film star

張學良.definition: Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army

張家口.definition: see 張家口市|张家口市[Zhang1jia1kou3 Shi4]

張家口市.definition: Zhangjiakou, prefecture-level city in Hebei Province 河北省[He2bei3 Sheng3]

張家川回族自治縣.pinyin: zhāng jiā chuān huí zú zì zhì xiàn
張家川回族自治縣.definition: Zhanjiachuan Huizu autonomous county in Gansu

張家港.definition: Zhangjiagang, county-level city in Suzhou 蘇州|苏州[Su1 zhou1], Jiangsu

張家港市.definition: Zhangjiagang, county-level city in Suzhou 蘇州|苏州[Su1 zhou1], Jiangsu

張家界.definition: see 張家界市|张家界市[Zhang1jia1jie4 Shi4]

張家界市.definition: Zhangjiajie, prefecture-level city in Hunan Province 湖南省[Hu2nan2 Sheng3]

張家長，李家短.pinyin: zhāng jiā zhǎng ， lǐ jiā duǎn
張家長，李家短.definition: lit. the Zhangs are better off than the Lis (idiom); to gossip about the neighbors

張寧.definition: Zhang Ning (1975-), PRC female badminton player and Olympic gold medalist

張寶.definition: Zhang Bao (-184), leader of the Yellow Turban rebels during the late Han 漢朝|汉朝[Han4 chao2]

張居正.definition: Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee

張店.definition: Zhangdian District of Zibo city 淄博市[Zi1 bo2 shi4], Shandong

張店區.definition: Zhangdian District of Zibo city 淄博市[Zi1 bo2 shi4], Shandong

張廷玉.definition: Zhang Tingyu (1672-1755), Qing politician, senior minister to three successive emperors, oversaw compilation of History of the Ming Dynasty 明史[Ming2 shi3] and the Kangxi Dictionary 康熙字典[Kang1 xi1 Zi4 dian3]

張心.definition: to be troubled; to be concerned

張志新.definition: Zhang Zhixin (1930-1975) female revolutionary and martyr, who followed the true Marxist-Leninist line as a party member, and was arrested in 1969, then executed in 1975 after opposing the counterrevolutionary party-usurping conspiracies of Lin Biao and the Gang of Four, and only rehabilitated posthumously in 1979

張怡.definition: Zhang Yi (1608-1695), prolific author and poet spanning interregnum between Ming and Qing

張怡寧.definition: Zhang Yining (1981-), PRC female table tennis player and Olympic gold medalist

張惠妹.definition: A-Mei, aka Gulilai Amit (1972-), aboriginal Taiwanese pop singer

張惶.definition: variant of 張皇|张皇[zhang1 huang2]

張戎.definition: Jung Chang (1952-), British-Chinese writer, name at birth Zhang Erhong 張二鴻|张二鸿[Zhang1 Er4 hong2], author of Wild Swans 野天鵝|野天鹅[Ye3 Tian1 e2] and Mao: The Unknown Story 毛澤東·鮮為人知的故事|毛泽东·鲜为人知的故事[Mao2 Ze2 dong1 · Xian1 wei2 ren2 zhi1 de5 Gu4 shi5]

張成澤.definition: Jang Song-taek (1946-2013), brother-in-law of Kim Jong-il 金正日[Jin1 Zheng4 ri4], uncle and mentor of Kim Jong-un 金正恩[Jin1 Zheng4 en1], in 2013 accused of being a counter-revolutionary and executed

張掖.definition: see 張掖市|张掖市[Zhang1ye4 Shi4]

張掖市.definition: Zhangye, prefecture-level city in Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1su4 Sheng3]

張掛.definition: to hang up (a picture, banner, mosquito net etc)

張揖.definition: Zhang Yi (c. 3rd century), literary figure from Wei of the Three Kingdoms, other name 稚讓|稚让[Zhi4 rang4], named as compiler of earliest extant Chinese encyclopedia 廣雅|广雅[Guang3 ya3] and several lost works

張揚.definition: to display ostentatiously; to bring out into the open; to make public; to spread around; flamboyant; brash

張敞.definition: Zhang Chang, official and scholar of the Western Han dynasty

張旭.definition: Zhang Xu (probably early 8th century), Tang dynasty poet and calligrapher, most famous for his grass script 草書|草书

張易之.definition: Zhang Yizhi (-705), Tang dynasty politician and favorite of Empress Wu Zetian 武則天|武则天[Wu3 Ze2 tian1]

張春帆.definition: Zhang Chunfan (-1935), late Qing novelist, author of The Nine-tailed Turtle 九尾龜|九尾龟

張春橋.definition: Zhang Chunqiao (1917-2005), one of the Gang of Four

張望.definition: to look around; to peep (through a crack); to peer at; to throw a look at

張柏芝.definition: Cecilia Cheung (1980-), Hong Kong actress and pop singer

張治中.definition: Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general

張溥.definition: Ming dynasty scholar (1602-1641), prolific writer, proponent of the Fushe 復社|复社[Fu4she4] cultural renewal movement, author of Five Men’s Tombstone Inscription 五人墓碑記|五人墓碑记[Wu3 Ren2 Mu4bei1ji4]

張灣.definition: Zhangwan district of Shiyan city 十堰市[Shi2 yan4 shi4], Hubei

張灣區.definition: Zhangwan district of Shiyan city 十堰市[Shi2 yan4 shi4], Hubei

張燈結彩.definition: to be decorated with lanterns and colored banners (idiom)

張牙舞爪.definition: to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures

張獻忠.definition: Zhang Xianzhong (1606-1647), leader of a late-Ming peasant revolt

張王李趙.definition: any Tom, Dick or Harry; anyone

張皇失措.definition: panic-stricken (idiom); to be in a flustered state; also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]

張純如.definition: Iris Chang (1968-2004), Chinese American historian and author of "The Rape of Nanking"

張羅.definition: to take care of; to raise money; to attend to (guests, customers etc)

張聞天.definition: Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist

張自忠.definition: Zhang Zizhong (1891-1940), Chinese National Revolutionary Army general during the Second Sino-Japanese War

張自烈.definition: Zhang Zilie (1597-1673), Ming dynasty scholar, author of Zhengzitong 正字通[Zheng4 zi4 tong1]

張若虛.definition: Zhang Ruoxu (c. 660-720), Tang dynasty poet, author of yuefu poem River on a spring night 春江花月夜

張華.definition: Zhang Hua (232-300), Western Jin writer, poet and politician; Zhang Hua (1958-1982), student held up as a martyr after he died saving an old peasant from a septic tank; other Zhang Hua's too numerous to mention

張蔭桓.definition: Zhang Yinhuan (1837-1900), late Qing politician and senior Chinese diplomat

張衡.definition: Zhang Heng (78-139) great Han dynasty astronomer and mathematician

張角.definition: Zhang Jue (-184), leader of the Yellow turban rebels during the late Han

張開.definition: to open up; to spread; to extend

張韶涵.definition: Angela Chang (1982-), Taiwanese pop singer and actress

張飛.definition: Zhang Fei (168-221), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, famous as fearsome fighter and lover of wine

張飛打岳飛.definition: lit. Zhang Fei fights Yue Fei; fig. an impossible combination; an impossible turn of events (idiom)

張騫.definition: Zhang Qian (-114 BC), Han dynasty explorer of 2nd century BC
